channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq hit all-time closing highs, but a drop in Apple stock capped gains from positive developments in US-China trade and fresh progress in the hunt for a COVID-19 vaccine.
item.title: ASX set to slip despite another record day on Wall Street

item.description: One of the oldest and best known gauges of the US stockmarket is welcoming three new additions, while three others to make way.
item.title: Blue-chip shuffle: The Dow Jones is getting a makeover to reflect a changing world

item.description: The company deemed it “the most inappropriate slogan for 2020" amid the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: KFC suspends ‘Its Finger Lickin’ Good’ slogan amid pandemic

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: A bill to introduce mandatory toll-free periods across new motorways is set to be debated in NSW Parliament.
item.title: Toll-free bill set for debate ahead of NorthConnex opening

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: Hugo Rich was a violent, calculating armed robber and murderer who wore Hugo Boss suits when he carried out his robberies. The Ladderman was a small time crook who wouldn’t hurt a fly. They are at opposite ends of the criminal food chain.
item.title: Naked City podcast: The Snake and The Ladderman

item.description: Polanski, 87, was expelled by the Academy in May 2018 because of a long-standing criminal case involving unlawful sex with a minor in 1977.
item.title: Director Roman Polanski loses court bid to be reinstated to Film Academy

item.description: The Kremlin said there were no grounds for a criminal investigation since it hadn't been fully established what caused the politician to fall into a coma.
item.title: Kremlin brushes off allegations in Navalny's poisoning

item.description: Spain's Prime Minister said troops would be made available to help following the country's worst week for infections since the epidemic's peak in late March.
item.title: Spain ready to send in troops to trace resurging coronavirus

item.description: Laura is projected to make landfall in the Texas-Louisiana border region late on Wednesday night or early Thursday morning as a major hurricane.
item.title: Hurricane Laura approaches US Gulf Coast, forcing thousands to evacuate

item.description: Jamaica's Minister of Health says legendary sprinter Usain Bolt has tested positive for the novel coronavirus.
item.title: Usain Bolt tests positive for COVID-19, Jamaican official says

item.description: A black man shot multiple times by police in Wisconsin is paralysed from the waist down and has "eight holes" in his body, his father says.
item.title: Jacob Blake's dad says son left paralysed by police shooting

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, August 26, 2020

item.description: A selection of his best work.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Davidson

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: UQ researchers have presented the final results of animal trials to an international scientific forum, with human trials already under way.
item.title: UQ vaccine safe, effective, and can be mass produced, researchers say

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: CSL and its global colleagues hope their product will have advantages over the treatment President Trump announced approvals for this week.
item.title: CSL powers forward with plasma treatment research

item.dc:creator: Greg Mullins
item.description: The government's approach to climate change reminds me of an incident when I was a full-time firefighter.
item.title: One night of terror when I was firefighting keeps coming back to me

item.dc:creator: Georgina Mitchell
item.description: Mr Kaftel borrowed money from former HIH director Rodney Adler without disclosing that he was an undischarged bankrupt.
item.title: Stanley Kaftel jailed for nine months over Rodney Adler deception

item.description: This ethical dilemma should be seen as a choice between accepting or not accepting a treatment that will limit the spread of a virulent disease that can kill.
item.title: Church has no business meddling in vaccine hunt

item.description: The state’s top ranking police officers have involved themselves in a criminal investigation in a way that raises basic questions of legality and due process.
item.title: NSW Police have questions to answer about the sad and sorry tale of Don Harwin

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: Seventeen years after his last interstate outing, Wayne Bennett is considering an 11th-hour SOS to coach the Maroons if Kevin Walters is appointed to succeed Anthony Seibold at the Broncos.
item.title: State of shock: Bennett on verge of fairytale Origin return

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Is there a better-performing spine in the NRL right now than star Rabbitohs quartet Latrell Mitchell, Cody Walker, Adam Reynolds and Damien Cook?
item.title: 'Latrell thrives under pressure': Souths boast NRL's strongest spine

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Incentives to lure women back to the workforce and boost their earnings and retirement savings will be unveiled by the Morrison government as part of a pandemic recovery plan.
item.title: Women's work a government focus for coronavirus recovery plans

item.dc:creator: Ross Gittins
item.description: It's our young people who'll carry the worst scars of the coronacession.
item.title: Morrison masterfully noncommittal on plan to help those hit hardest

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: Inside the usually buzzing Strand Arcade, three businesses on street level have permanently closed.
item.title: Amid shuttered shops, hat seller Hamish says eerily quiet mall is 'upsetting'

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Wednesday, August 26

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Diversified property group Stockland is confident the bounce back in the residential market will help to underpin its business after reporting a loss of $14 million.
item.title: Stockland sees housing market as its saviour after reporting loss

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Aventus Group benefited from the working-from-home rush for computer and electrical goods, appliances and general household items.
item.title: Big box landlord upgraded by analysts after solid results

item.dc:creator: Michael Cockerill
item.description: There had been many false dawns for football in Australia. But the game's new keepers predicted a bright future with the start of the A-League.
item.title: From the Archives, 2005: A league of their own

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target Time and superquiz, Wednesday, August 26

item.dc:creator: John Hewson
item.description: You can be sure the practice is more widespread than just the major scandals that come to light from time to time, but still there is no genuine commitment to eliminate it, or even contain it
item.title: Leaders must respond to 'cancerous' branch stacking

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: New research from the Australia Council for the Arts shows an increased regard for the arts and culture among Australians.
item.title: Social cohesion, happiness: parents see value in introducing young kids to the arts

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: Melissa Babbage rejoins corporate life in Australia this week while husband Joe Hockey builds his corporate career in the US.
item.title: Babbage goes the distance with Swiss Re

item.dc:creator: Nick McKenzie
item.description: New messages and emails show the assistant federal treasurer was personally involved in a potentially illegal scheme to use taxpayer funded staff as factional operatives.
item.title: Sukkar helped install factional operatives in Kevin Andrews' office

item.description: To think that for a year and a half Victorians would not be living in the state of Victoria but in the "state of emergency” is unacceptable.
item.title: Victorians cannot keep sacrificing liberties without a safety net

item.dc:creator: Timna Jacks
item.description: Victoria's V/Line regional rail operator has been accused of underpaying a cleaning contractor more than $1 million in a case lodged in the Supreme Court.
item.title: Cleaners take V/Line to court over alleged underpayment

item.description: Admissions of fault are offered late, and sometimes not at all. We shouldn’t be surprised by this; after all, our world has little tolerance for mistakes.
item.title: Mistakes, and the importance of admitting them

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: A Toorak jewellery store worker who confronted a gang of armed robbers has been honoured for his courage.
item.title: Bravery award winner's message of hope for teen assailant

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: A narrow focus on small policy changes is preventing wider structural shifts that can benefit all retirees in retirement.
item.title: Will politics step aside so we can get super policy right?

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Australian defence reservists will be recruited for longer and military bases across the country upgraded under a $1 billion boost to the nation's defences.
item.title: More Defence reservists to combat coronavirus and natural disasters

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: Separately, a Sydney Apple Store and a Kmart have had confirmation a person who tested positive for COVID-19 visited its stores on Saturday.
item.title: NSW Police reviewing infection control at hotel quarantine as health alert issued for CBD gym, three schools close

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Joe Daniher is poised to be named for his first game in more than 15 months with Essendon clearing the key forward to take on Hawthorn at Adelaide Oval on Thursday night.
item.title: Daniher poised to come straight back

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The actions of Townsville City Council employee Glen Hardy played a major role in saving 60 residents' lives in 2019.
item.title: National bravery award for truck driver after Townsville flood heroics

item.description: The super system was never designed to be a catch-all for the economy’s ills and it is not a good idea to be viewed as such.
item.title: Long-term investment key to your super – best leave it alone

item.dc:creator: Tim Barlass
item.description: Sam Oweck called triple 0 at 2.37am. "There's been a boat accident on the harbour. You need to get someone out here. Mate."
item.title: Fishermen receive bravery award over maritime tragedy on Sydney Harbour

item.dc:creator: Noel Whittaker
item.description: Knowing that you have the best speeds, the most data, the best plans and the lowest mortgage rate is a great feeling.
item.title: Bills getting on top of you? Just pick up the phone

item.description: You can now get 100 per cent Greenpower for about the same cost as the government’s regulated 'fair price for electricity'.
item.title: Electricity bills: it's so easy to go green
